metadata.Title: CVE-2014-0064 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Multiple integer overflows in the path_in and other unspecified functions in PostgreSQL before 8.4.20, 9.0.x before 9.0.16, 9.1.x before 9.1.12, 9.2.x before 9.2.7, and 9.3.x before 9.3.3 allow remote authenticated users to have unspecified impact and attack vectors, which trigger a buffer overflow. NOTE: this identifier has been SPLIT due to different affected versions; use CVE-2014-2669 for the hstore vector.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-0064` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

postgresql-plperl-9.1 - 9.1.12-1
No subscription required

libecpg-compat3 - 9.3.3-1
libecpg6 - 9.3.3-1
libpgtypes3 - 9.3.3-1
libpq5 - 9.3.3-1
postgresql-9.3 - 9.3.3-1
postgresql-client-9.3 - 9.3.3-1
postgresql-contrib-9.3 - 9.3.3-1
postgresql-plperl-9.3 - 9.3.3-1
postgresql-plpython-9.3 - 9.3.3-1
postgresql-plpython3-9.3 - 9.3.3-1
postgresql-pltcl-9.3 - 9.3.3-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: postgresql-9.1 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '9.1.12-1').
postgresql-9.3 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '9.3.3-1').
